com.gnahraf.io.buffer

Class BufferUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.io.buffer.BufferUtils

  • public class BufferUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for manipulating buffers. Nothing magical here; just a bit of rigor.
    Author:
    Babak
    See Also:
    BufferOp

    • Method Detail

      • setCell

        public static ByteBuffer setCell(ByteBuffer buffer,
                 int cellIndex,
                 int cellbytes)
        Positions the given buffer at the start of the specified cell. Arguments are not checked. 
        
   int position = cellIndex * cellbytes;
   int limit = position + cellbytes;
   buffer.limit(limit).position(position);
        Parameters:
        cellIndex - zero based cell index (starts at the beginning of the buffer)
        cellbytes - number of bytes in each buffer
        Returns:
        buffer

      • binaryFirst

        public static int binaryFirst(ByteBuffer[] cells,
              ByteBuffer key,
              Comparator<ByteBuffer> order)
        Returns the first index of the specified key, assuming the cells are sorted in ascending order. Results are undefined otherwise. If no matching cell is found, then the [negative] index returned has the same semantics as that specified in Arrays.binarySearch(Object[], Object, Comparator).
        Parameters:
        order - if null, then searched in lexical order

      • binaryLast

        public static int binaryLast(ByteBuffer[] cells,
             ByteBuffer key,
             Comparator<ByteBuffer> order)
        Returns the last index of the specified key, assuming the cells are sorted in ascending order. Results are undefined otherwise. If no matching cell is found, then the [negative] index returned has the same semantics as that specified in Arrays.binarySearch(Object[], Object, Comparator).
        Parameters:
        order - if null, then searched in lexical order
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if key, cells, or any of its elements is null

      • binarySearch

        public static int binarySearch(ByteBuffer[] cells,
               ByteBuffer key,
               Comparator<ByteBuffer> order)
        Binary searches for the specified key, assuming the cells are sorted in ascending order. Results are undefined otherwise. If no matching cell is found, then the [negative] index returned has the same semantics as that specified in Arrays.binarySearch(Object[], Object, Comparator).

        This method behaves exactly as binaryFirst and binaryLast, if there are no duplicate cells (except that its faster); if there are dups, and there is a hit on a dupe, then there is no guarantee which of the dups is chosen. 

        
      public int binarySearch(ByteBuffer[] cells, ByteBuffer key, Comparator order) {
        return Arrays.binarySearch(cells, key, order);
      }
        Parameters:
        order - if null, then searched in lexical order
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if key, cells, or any of its elements is null

      • isSorted

        public static boolean isSorted(ByteBuffer[] cells,
               Comparator<ByteBuffer> order)
        Tests whether the cells are currently sorted.
        Parameters:
        order - if null, then searched in lexical order
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if cells or any of its elements is null
